paper.title: SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccines sensitize tumours to immune checkpoint blockade

core_question: Does intratumoral delivery of an mRNA vaccine create an interferon-rich inflammatory state that improves sensitivity to anti-PD-L1 therapy?

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Mouse efficacy cohort
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Tumor-bearing mice pooled across repeat experiments for combination therapy.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Mouse control cohort
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Tumor-bearing mice pooled across matched controls for various arms.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Human retrospective cohort
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Metastatic patients receiving ICI treatment compared by vaccine status.

major_limitations: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.
Vaccination timing relative to ICI initiation varied across patients.
Tumor-type mix and treatment-history heterogeneity limit direct causal interpretation.
Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.
Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly.
